Animals might have difficulty moving around due to the increased weight and size of their bodies. This could make it difficult for them to hunt or escape predators.
The increased size could also affect their behavior and social interactions, as they may have difficulty communicating and interacting with other animals of their species.
The increased size could lead to changes in their dietary needs, as larger animals may require more food to sustain themselves.
The increased size could also make animals more vulnerable to diseases and illnesses, as their larger bodies may provide more space for harmful bacteria and viruses to multiply.
The increased size could also affect their ability to survive in their natural environment, as larger animals may require more space and resources to live comfortably.
